data.title: Dismember
data.article:
Dismember (from to dismember 'dismember', 'dismember') is a Swedish death metal Band from Stockholm, formed in 1988. It emerged from the band Carnage and, together with the band Entombed, is considered one of the trend-setting bands of Swedish death metal.They disbanded in October 2011 and were then re-established in 2019.

History

After several demos, Dismember released their first album Like an Ever Flowing Stream in 1991. It appeared on Nuclear Blast. The album Indecent & Obscene was criticized by youth protection agencies because of the brutal front cover.The open torso of drummer Fred Estby is on the cover. Embedded in it is the Dismember logo. In 1991, the back cover of the first album caused controversy. On it are the band members covered in blood and bare-chested at St. Peter's and Latin crosses.

The logo was designed by Nicke Andersson (Nihilist, Entombed, Hellacopters...).

After the band went on hiatus between 2000 and 2004, 2004 saw the release of Where Ironcrosses Grow a new album.

In 2004 the DVD Live Blasphemies was released.In addition to a live concert, it also contains an approximately two-hour biography in the form of interviews and live recordings of older performances.

While many other Scandinavian death metal bands in the mid-90s reduced their style somewhat in heaviness , Dismember always stayed very close to their roots with their releases.

After more than 20 years, the penultimate founding member, drummer Fred Estby, left Dismember at the end of April 2007. According to the official report on the website, Estby wants to spend more time with his family in the future and can therefore no longer be available to the band. He was replaced by Thomas Daun.

On 22.On November 1st, 2008, the band played a special concert to celebrate their 20th anniversary. Titles from all eras and albums were presented chronologically in the respective line-up.

In June 2009 the DVD Under Blood Red Skies was released, which shows the performance at the party.San Festival 2008 as well as an extensive documentation with material from the entire band history.

In 2011 the band announced that they would break up after 23 years of existence.

Discography

Albums

  • 1991: Like an Everflowing Stream
  • 1993: Indecent & Obscene
  • 1995: Massive Killing Capacity
  • 1997: Death Metal
  • 2000: Hate Campaign
  • 2004: Where Ironcrosses Grow
  • 2006: The God That Never Was
  • 2008: Dismember

EPs

  • 1992: Pieces
  • 1995: Casket Garden
  • 1997: Misanthropic

Demos

  • 1988: Dismembered
  • 1989: Last Blasphemies
  • 1989: Rehearsal
  • 1990: Reborn In Blasphemy

Singles

  • 1991: Skin Her Alive

Videoalben

  • 2004: Live Blasphemies (DVD)
  • 2009: Under Blood Red Skies (2DVD)

Weblinks

  • Interview from March 2008
